turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 188th Armored Brigade.
turn.1: What did the 188th Armored Brigade do in the Battle of Sulul?
turn.2: Nafshi moved his battalion position 1.5 km forward from its previous defensive position, a maneuver that saved his men and machines from the Syrian artillery barrage.
turn.3: What else did they do in the battle?
turn.4: His was the only remaining tank force, equipped with 36 Israeli modified Centurion tanks to fight the Syrians for 3 continuous days, until reinforcements and reserves were moved into positions.
turn.6: His battalion was reinforced with a tank company from the 53rd battalion.
turn.8: After 4 days of fighting, his battalion was reduced to 5 operational tanks.
turn.10: More than 102 soldiers and officers died defending the southern Golan Line, from reinforced points (bunkers) 107 to 114.
turn.12: For his gallant, professional, and courageous behavior during the war, Yair Nafshi received Israel's second highest decoration, the Medal of Valor.
